description: A Chinese-American chef, Yan is a familiar face in the world of Chinese cuisine, particularly through his TV show Yan Can Cook. Yan is also an accomplished cookbook author and has taught cooking classes around the world. He is known for his dynamic and entertaining cooking style, as well as his deep knowledge of Chinese ingredients and techniques.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.ingredients: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast cut into small pieces, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns, 1 tbsp minced ginger, 1 tbsp minced garlic
recipes.cookingmethod: Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.Add the peppercorns and stir-fry for a few seconds until fragrant.Add the chicken and stir-fry until lightly browned.Add the ginger and garlic and stir-fry for a few seconds until fragrant.Add the soy sauce and wine and stir-fry for a few seconds.

description: Born in the United States to Chinese immigrant parents, Tsai is a celebrated chef and restaurateur. He is known for his fusion cuisine, which blends traditional Chinese flavors with other international influences. In addition to his work in the kitchen, Tsai is also an advocate for sustainability in food and has served on the board of the Monterey Bay Aquarium's Seafood Watch program.

description: Born in the United States but raised in China, Hom is a world-renowned chef and cookbook author. He is particularly known for his expertise in wok cooking and his ability to create authentic Chinese dishes using simple ingredients. Hom has written over 30 cookbooks and has won numerous awards for his contributions to Chinese cuisine.

description: A British chef and TV host, Huang has made a name for herself with her fresh, modern take on Chinese cooking. description: A Singaporean chef, Leung has made a name for himself with his elegant and refined Chinese cuisine. He has worked in some of the world's top restaurants, including the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong and the Waldorf Astoria in Shanghai.
